channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Abandoned bicycle for a month, 7th August
item.description:
The bicycle is in the way of both pedestrians and motor vehicles and has been left there for a month.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 80, Basinghall Street, City of London

item.title: 2 council road closed signs dumped in the grass., 7th August
item.description:
2 council road closed signs dumped in the grass from when the closed the road to clear fly tip. They are almost buried in the grass now - perhaps like the panels dumped further down the lane its more costly to send someone to collect them - tax payers money and all that not a good look is it!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cookham Road, St Mary Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sweeping üßπ, 7th August

item.title: Dumped council plastic fence sections, 7th August
item.description:
After a recent fly tip the fence panels used to block off the area the panels were dumped in the ditch/hedge. Along the perimeter fence of Meadow House. Been there for weeks. Is it more expensive to collect them than their cost?? what a waste... literally!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hockenden Lane, St Mary Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped cupboard and dangerous concrete bricks, 7th August
item.description:
Can The Yellow Greenwich council van please come over and remove the fly tipping done. As the concrete bricks are dangerous and can cause serious injury if someone trips over. It has been there for months and I don't see the Greenwich council guys pick it up sadly (Peabody have said this is on Greenwich council's property to deal with)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Avocet Mews, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 space for customer parking is free for business, 7th August
item.description:
I write Mr Kamlesh Patel, tel. 02084784878. THIS IS ME TO the proprietor of Londis at 128 ‚Äì 130 Church Road, Manor Park, London, E12 6HL. BEFORE WE HAVE TO TWO SPACE FOR CUSTOMER PARKING I AM keen that the local authority remove the double yellow line at the front of his shop. There was previously a bay which permitted customers to park for thirty minutes between 9 a.m. and 5 p.m. This has been removed, much to Mr Patel‚Äôs chagrin. A number of his customers have commented on this, saying it is now less convenient to drop-in to to Mr Patel‚Äôs shop.

Report on FixMyStreet
